Name: Thyme for...
Ingredients: 1 cube Demerara / dark Muscovado / brown sugar
3 dash Peychaud's or other Creole-style bitters
15 ml Grand Marnier or other cognac orange liqueur
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of scorched thyme sprig.
DASH bitters over sugar cube in stirring glass.
ADD other ingredients and stir to dissolve sugar.
Review: It most certainly is! As the name suggests, aromatic thyme subtly influences this spirituous cognac-based cocktail, with Grand Marnier adding rich but delicate zesty orange notes.
History: Adapted from a recipe created by Tom Noori at Montpellier Wine Bar in Cheltenham, England
